juzs.text: Concerning what they are disputing
Concerning the great announcement
About which they cannot agree
Indeed they will soon come to know
Again, indeed they will soon come to know
Have We not made the earth as a wide expanse
And the mountains as pegs
And created you mates
And made your sleep for rest
And made the night as a covering
And made the day as a means of subsistence
And built over you the seven firmaments
And placed a light of splendor
And do We not send down from the clouds water in abundance
That We may produce with it grains and vegetables
And gardens of luxurious growth
Indeed the day of sorting out is a thing appointed
The day the trumpet will be sounded, and you will come forth in crowds
And the heavens will be opened as if there were doors
And the mountains will vanish, as if they were a mirage
Truly hell is a place of ambush
For the transgressors a place of destination
They will dwell therein for ages
Nothing cool will they taste therein, nor any drink
Except a boiling fluid, and a fluid dark, murky, intensely cold
A fitting reward
Because they feared not any account for their deeds
And they treated Our signs as false
All things have We preserved on record
So taste this, for no increase will We grant you, except in punishment
Indeed for the righteous there will be a fulfillment of their desires
Gardens enclosed, and grapevines
Companions of equal age
And a cup, full
No vanity will they hear therein, nor lies
Reward from your Lord, a gift sufficient
From the Guardian Evolver of the heavens and the earth, and all between. God, the Merciful Benefactor, none will have power to argue with Him
The day the Spirit and the Angels will stand forth in ranks. None will speak except those permitted by God, the Merciful Benefactor, and he will say what is true
That day will be the true reality. Therefore, whoever wills, let him anticipate the return to his Lord
Indeed, We have warned you of a penalty near, the day when humanity will see that which their hands have sent forth, and the unbeliever will say, “Oh my God, I wish that I were mere dust.”
By those who tear it out with violence
By those who gently draw it out
And by those who glide along
Then press forward as in a race
And plan to do it
One day all that can be in commotion will be in violent commotion
Followed by repeated commotions
Hearts that day will be in agitation
Their eyes will be caste down
They say, “What, will we indeed be returned to our former state
“What, when we will have become decayed bones?”
They say, “It would, in that case, be a return with loss.”
But indeed, it will be but a single cry
When behold, they will be in the awakening
Has the story of Moses reached you
Behold, your Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa
“Go to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds
“And say to him, ‘Do you want to be purified
“And that I guide you to your Lord, so you can fear Him?”
Then Moses showed him the great sign
But he rejected it and did not follow
Further, he turned his back, striving hard
Then he gathered them and made a proclamation
Saying, “I am your Lord, Most High”
But God punished him, and made an example of him, in the hereafter, and in the present life
Indeed in this is an instructive warning for whoever is conscious of God
What, are you more difficult to create or the heaven? God has constructed it
And on high has He raised its canopy, and He has given it order and perfection
Its night does He endow with darkness, and its splendor does He bring out
And the earth, moreover, has He extended
He draws out from there its moisture and its pasture
And the mountains has He firmly fixed
For use and convenience for you and your livestock
Therefore, when there comes the great overwhelming event
The day when humanity will remember all that they strove for
And hellfire will be placed in full view, for all to see
Then for those who transgressed all bounds
And had preferred the life of the present
The abode will be hellfire
And for those who had entertained the fear of standing before their Lord, and have restrained their soul from lower desires
Their abode will be the garden
They ask you about the Hour, “When will its appointed time be?”
Are you concerned with the declaration of it
With your Lord is the finale
You are only a warner for those who fear it
The day they see it, it will be as if they had stayed but a single evening, or until the following morn
He frowned and turned away
Because there came to him the blind man
But how could you know whether he might be purified
Or that he might receive advice, and the teaching might profit him
As for one who regards Himself as self-sufficient
To him you attend
Though it is no blame on you if he grows not
But as to him who came to you striving earnestly
And with consciousness
Of him were you unmindful
By no means should this be so, for it is indeed a message of instruction
So whosoever wills, may ponder it
In books held in honor
Exalted and purified
By the hands of scribes
Honorable, pious and just
Woe to humanity, what has made them reject God
From what has He created them
From a zygote, He has created him, and then molds them in due proportions
Then He makes his path smooth for him
Then He causes him to die, and puts him in his grave
Then, when it is His will, He will raise him up
By no means has he fulfilled what God has asked of him
Then let the human being look at his food
And that We pour out water in abundance
And We split the earth into pieces
And produce therein corn
Grapes and nutritious plants
Olives and dates
And enclosed gardens, dense with lofty trees
And fruits and fodder
For use and convenience for you and your livestock
Then when there comes the deafening noise
The day one will flee from his own brother
And from his mother and his father
And from his wife and children
Each one of them, that day, will have enough concern to make him indifferent to the others
Some faces that day will be beaming
Laughing, rejoicing
And other faces that day will be dust-stained
Darkness will cover them
Such will be the rejecters of God, the immoral
When the sun is folded up
When the stars fall, losing their luster
When the mountains vanish
When the she-camels, ten months with young, are left untended
When the wild creatures are herded together
When the oceans are made to overflow
When the souls are sorted out
When the female infant buried alive is asked
For what crime she was killed
When the scrolls are laid open
When the world on high is unveiled
When the blazing fire is kindled to a fierce blaze
And when the garden is brought near
Then will each soul know what it has put forward
So indeed I call to witness the planets that recede
Go straight or hide
And the night as it disappears
And the dawn as it breathes away the darkness
Indeed it is the word of an honorable messenger
Endued with power, with rank before the Lord of the throne
With authority there, and faithful to his trust
And your companion is not one possessed
And without doubt he saw him on the clear horizon
He neither grudgingly withholds knowledge of the unknown
Nor is it the word of Satan
So where are you going
Indeed it is no less than a message to all the worlds
For whomever among you wills to go straight
But you will not will, except as God wills, the Lord of all the worlds
When the universe is ripped apart
When the stars are scattered
When the oceans are made to gush forth
And when the graves are turned upside down
Then each soul will know what it has sent forward and what it has kept back
O human being, what has seduced you from your Guardian Evolver, the Most Honorable
He Who created you, fashioned you and balanced you
In whatever form He wills, He puts you together
No, you reject right and judgment
But indeed over you are appointed angels to protect you
Kind and honorable, writing
They know all that you do
As for the righteous, they will be in bliss
And as for the wicked, they will be in the fire
Which they will enter on the Day of Accountability
And they will not be able to stay away from it
And what will explain to you what the Day of Accountability is
Again, what will explain to you what the Day of Accountability is
The day when no soul will have power to do anything for another, for the decision, that day, will be with God
Shame on those who are unethical
Those who, when they have to receive an amount from others, demand the full amount
But when they have to give an amount to others, give less than owed
Do they not think that they will be called to account
On a mighty day
A day when all of humanity will stand before the Lord of all the worlds
No, surely the record of the corrupt is in sijjin
And what will explain to you what sijjin is
It is a register inscribed
Woe that day, to those who deny it
Those who deny the Day of Accountability
And none deny it but every transgressor beyond bounds, those who are corrupt
When Our signs are rehearsed to him, he says, “Tales of the ancients.”
By no means, but on their hearts is the stain of that which they do
Indeed, from their Lord that day, they will be veiled
Further, they will enter the fire of hell
Further, it will be said to them, “This is that which you rejected as false
No, indeed the record of the righteous is in illiyin
And what will explain to you what illiyin is
It is a register inscribed
To which those nearest bear witness
Truly the righteous will be in bliss
From on thrones, they observe
You will recognize in their faces the beaming brightness of bliss
Their thirst will be quenched with natural juice, sealed
The seal of it will be musk, and for this let those aspire who have aspirations
With it will be a mixture of tasnim
A spring, from which those nearest to God will drink
Those in sin used to laugh at those who believed
And whenever they passed by them, they used to wink at each other
And when they returned to their people, they would return joking
And whenever they saw them, they would say, “Behold, these are indeed people astray.”
But they had not been sent as keepers over them
But on this day, the believers will laugh at the unbelievers
On thrones they will observe
Will the unbelievers not have been paid back for what they did
When the universe is ripped apart
And it listens to its Guardian Evolver, as it must
And when the earth is flattened out
And casts up what is within it and becomes empty
And listens to its Lord, as it must
O human beings, indeed you are toiling on towards your Lord, ever toiling, but you will meet Him
Then he who is given his record in his right hand
Soon his account will be taken by an easy reckoning
And he will turn to his people rejoicing
But he who is given his record behind his back
Soon he will cry for perdition
And he will enter a blazing fire
Indeed he went about among his people, rejoicing
Indeed he thought that he would not have to return to Us
No, no, for his Lord was watchful of him
So I call to witness the ruddy glow of sunset
The night and its homing
And the moon in its fullness
You will surely travel from stage to stage
What then is the matter with them that they do not believe
And when the Quran is read to them, they do not fall prostrate
But instead the unbelievers reject it
But God has full knowledge of what they hide
So announce to them a terrible penalty
Except to those who believe and do righteous deeds, for them is a reward that will never fail
By the sky, displaying the constellations
By the promised day
By one who witnesses, and the subject of the witness
Woe to the makers of the pit
The fire supplied with fuel
Behold, they sat over against the fire
And they witnessed all that they were doing against the believers
And they treated them wrongfully for no other reason than that they believed in God, the All Mighty, the Praiseworthy
Him to Whom belongs the control of the heavens and the earth, and God is witness to all things
Those who persecute or draw into temptation the believers, men and women, and do not turn in repentance, will have the penalty of hell. They will have the penalty of the burning fire
For those who believe and do righteous deeds, will be gardens with rivers flowing through them. That is the great salvation
Truly strong is the Grip of your Lord
It is He Who originates and repeats
And He is the Oft-Forgiving, Full of Loving-Kindness
Lord of the throne of glory
Doer of all that He intends
Has the story reached you, of the forces
Of Pharaoh and the Thamud
And yet the unbelievers persist in rejecting
But God encompasses them from behind
No, this is a glorious Quran
On material preserved
By the galaxy and the night visitant
And what will explain to you what the night-visitant is
It is the star of piercing brightness
There is no soul that does not have a protector over it
Now let the human being think about from what he is created
He is created from a drop emitted
Proceeding from between the backbone and the ribs
Surely God is able to bring him back
The day that all things secret will be tested
They will have no power and no helper
By the firmament which returns
And by the earth which cracks open
Behold this is the word that is decisive
It is not a thing for entertainment
As for them, they are plotting a scheme
But I am devising a plan
Therefore grant respite to the unbelievers. Give respite to them for a while
Glory to the name of your Lord Most High
Who has created, and further gives order and proportion
Who has ordained laws, and granted guidance
And Who makes the pasture grow
And then makes it dark stubble
By degrees We will teach you to declare the message, so you will not forget
Except what God wills, for He knows what is manifest and what is hidden
And We will ease you to what is easy
Therefore give advice, in case the advice profits
The advice will be received by those who are conscious of God
But it will be avoided by the most unfortunate ones
Who will enter the great fire
In which they will then neither die nor live
But those will flourish who refine themselves
And glorify the name of their Lord in prayer
No, you prefer the life of the present
But the hereafter is better and longer lasting
And this is in the Ancient Books
The Books of Abraham and Moses
Has the story reached you of the overwhelming event
Some faces that day will be humiliated
Laboring hard
While they are entering the blazing fire
While they are given drink, from a boiling hot spring
No food will there be for them but a bitter Dhari’
That will neither nourish nor satisfy hunger
Faces that day will be joyful
Pleased with their striving
In a garden on high
Where they will hear no vanity
There will be a bubbling spring
There will be thrones raised on high
Goblets placed
And cushions set in rows
And rich carpets spread out
Do they not look at the camels, how they are made
And at the sky, how it is raised high
And at the mountains, how they are firmly fixed
And at the earth, how it is spread out
Therefore give advice, for you are one to advise
You are not one to manage their affairs
But if any turn away and reject God
God will punish him with a mighty punishment
To Us will be their return
Then it will be for Us to call them to account
By the dawn
By the ten nights
By the even and odd
And by the night when it passes away
Is there not in these an oath for those who understand
Do you not see how your Lord dealt with the ‘Ad
Of Iram, with lofty pillars
The like of which were not produced in all the land
And with the Thamud, who carved out rocks in the valley
And with Pharaoh, lord of stakes
All of these transgressed beyond bounds in the lands
And spread corruption therein
Therefore your Lord poured on them a scourge of diverse chastisements
For your Lord is on a watchtower
Now, as for humanity, when their Lord tries them, giving them honor and gifts, they then say, “My Lord has honored me.”
But when He tries them, restricting subsistence from them, he says then, “My Lord has humiliated me.”
But no, you do not honor the orphans
Nor do you encourage one another to feed the poor
And you devour inheritance, all with greed
And you love wealth with inordinate love
No, when the earth is pounded to powder
And your Lord comes, and His angels, rank upon rank
And hell, that day, is brought forth, on that day will the human being remember, but how will that remembrance profit him
He will say, “I wish that I had invested in my life.”
For that day, their chastisement will be such as none else can inflict
And His bonds will be such as none other can bind
To the righteous soul it will be said, “O you soul in complete rest and satisfaction
“Come back to your Lord, well pleased, and well-pleasing
“Enter then among My devotees
“Yes, enter My paradise
I call to witness this city
And you are free in this city
As are the parent and child
Indeed We have created the human being into toil and struggle
Do they think that none has power over them
They may say, “Wealth have I accumulated in abundance
Does he think that no one sees him
Have We not made for him a pair of eyes
And a tongue, and a pair of lips
And shown him the two highways
But he has made no rush to the path that is steep
And what will explain to you the path that is steep
It is freeing the captive
Or giving food in a day of hunger
To the orphan who claims relationship
Or to the indigent down in the dust
Then will he be of those who believe, and encourage patience, and encourage deeds of kindness and compassion
These are the companions of the right hand
But those who reject Our signs, they are the companions of the left hand
On them will be fire vaulted all around
By the sun and its splendor
By the moon as it follows it
By the day as it shows its glory
By the night as it conceals it
By the firmament and its structure
By the earth and its expanse
By the soul, and the proportion and order given to it
And its enlightenment as to its difficulty and its consciousness
Certainly she succeeds who purifies it
And she fail who corrupts it
The Thamud rejected through their inordinate wrongdoing
Behold, their representative was the most terrible person among them
But the messenger of God said to them, “It is a she-camel of God, so let it have a drink.”
Then they rejected him, and they hamstrung it. So their Lord, on account of their crime, obliterated their traces and leveled them
And for Him is no fear of its consequences
By the night as it conceals
By the day as it appears in glory
By the creation of male and female
Indeed, what you strive for is diverse
So he who gives and is conscious of God
And testifies to the best
We will indeed make smooth for him the path to bliss
But he who suffers from greed and thinks himself self-sufficient
And denies the best
We will indeed make smooth for him the path to misery
Nor will his wealth profit him when he falls headlong
Indeed We take upon Ourselves to guide
And indeed to Us belong the end and the beginning
Therefore I warn you of a fire blazing fiercely
None will reach it but the most unfortunate ones
Who give the lie to truth and turn their backs
But those most devote will be removed far from it
Those who give their wealth for self-purification
And have in their minds no favor from anyone, for which a reward is expected in return
But only the desire to seek for the Countenance of their Lord Most High
And soon will they attain satisfaction
By the glorious morning light
And by the night when it is still
Your Lord has not abandoned you, nor is He displeased
And indeed the future will be better for you than the present
And soon your Lord will give you that with which you will be well pleased
Did He not find you an orphan and give you shelter
And He found you wandering, and He gave you guidance
And He found you in need, and made you independent
Therefore, treat not the orphan with harshness
Nor refuse the petitioner
But the bounty of your Lord, proclaim
Have We not expanded your chest
And removed from you your burden
Which galled your back
And raised high the esteem you are held
So indeed, with every difficulty there is relief
Indeed, with every difficulty there is relief
Therefore, when you are free, still labor hard
And turn all of your attention to your Lord
By the fig and the olive
And Mount Sinai
And this city of security
We have indeed created the human being in the best of forms
Then We debase them to the lowest of the low
Except those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward unfailing
Then what can, after this, deceive you about the judgment
Is not God the Wisest of Judges
Read, in the name of your Lord who created
Created the human being from a zygote
Proclaim, and your Lord is Most Bountiful
He Who taught the use of the pen
Taught the human being that which he knew not
No, but the human being transgresses all bounds
When he looks upon himself as self-sufficient
Indeed, to your Lord is the return
Do you see one who forbids
A worshipper when he turns to pray
Have you seen whether he has guidance
Or encourages righteousness
Do you see if he denies and turns away
Does he not know that God sees
Let him beware, that if he does not desist, We will drag him by the hair of his head
His lying, sinful head
Then let him call to his advisers
We will call on the angels of punishment
No, do not follow, but bow down in adoration, and bring yourself ever closer
We have indeed revealed it in the Night of Power
And what will explain to you what the Night of Power is
The Night of Power is as good as a thousand months
There comes down the angels and the spirit by God's permission, for every will
Peace, until the rise of morn
Those who reject it among the people of the Book and among the polytheists were not going to depart until there came to them clear evidence
A messenger from God, rehearsing scriptures kept pure
In it are laws, right and straight
Nor did the people of the Book form sects, until after there came to them clear evidence
And they have been asked no more than this— to worship God, offer Him sincere devotion, be truthful, establish prayer, and give zakat, and that is the way of life which is right and straight
Those who reject it among the people of the Book and among the polytheists, will be in hellfire, to dwell therein forever. They are the worst of creatures
Those who have faith and do righteous deeds, they are the best of creatures

Their reward with God is gardens of eternity, beneath which rivers flow, they will dwell therein forever, God well pleased with them, and they with Him. All this for those who are conscious of their Lord
When the earth is shaken to its utmost convulsion
And the earth throws up its burden
And the human being yells, “What is the matter with it?”
On that day it will declare its information
Because your Lord would have given it inspiration
On that day, humanity will proceed in groups sorted out, to be shown their deeds
Then anyone who has done an atom’s weight of good see it
And anyone who has done an atom’s weight of wrong will see it
By those who race with panting breath
And strike sparks of fire
And push home the charge in the morning
And raise the dust in clouds
And move forward en masse
Truly the human being is ungrateful to their Guardian Evolver
And to that they bear witness
And violent is their love of wealth
Does he not know, when that which is in the graves is scattered abroad
And that which is in the chest is made manifest
That their Guardian Evolver had been well acquainted with them that day
The Disaster
What is the Disaster
And what will explain to you what the Disaster is
It is a day when humanity will be like scattered moths
And the mountains will be as wool
Then he whose scales will be heavy
Will be in a life of blessings and satisfaction
But he whose scale will be found light
Will have his home in a pit
And what will explain to you what this is
It is a fire blazing fiercely
The competition for accumulating diverts you
Until you all visit the graves
But no, you will soon know
Again, you will soon know
No, were you to know with certainty of mind
You will certainly see hellfire
Again, you will see it with certainty of sight
Then, you will be questioned that day about the pleasure you indulged in
By time
Indeed the human being is lost
Except those who have faith, work to make things right, and join together in the mutual teaching of truth, patience, and constancy
Woe to every scandalous, backbiter
Who accumulates wealth and counts it
Thinking that his wealth will make him last forever
By no means. He will surely be thrown into that which breaks into pieces
And what will explain to you about that which breaks into pieces
It is the fire of God kindled to a blaze
That mounts right up to the hearts
It will be made into a vault over them
In columns, extended
Do you not see how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant
Did He not make their treacherous plan go astray
And He sent against them flocks of birds
Striking them with stones of baked clay
Then He made them like an empty field of stalks and straw which has been eaten
For the security enjoyed by the Quraysh
Their security covering journeys by winter and summer
Let them adore the Guardian Evolver of this house
Who provides them with food against hunger, and with security against fear of danger
Do you see the one who denies the Judgment
They are those who repulse the orphan
And do not encourage the feeding of the indigent
So woe to the worshippers
Who are neglectful of their prayers
Those who want to be seen
But refuse to do even neighborly deeds
To you, We have granted the fountain of abundance
Therefore turn in prayer and sacrifice to your Lord
For he who hates you, he will be cut off
Say, O you who do not believe
I do not worship that which you worship
Nor will you worship that which I worship
And I will not worship that which you are accustomed to worshiping
Nor will you worship that which I worship
To you your way, and to me, my way
When the help of God and victory comes
And you see the people enter God's religion in crowds
Glorify by Praising your Guardian Evolver, and pray for His forgiveness, for He is Oft-Forgiving
May the hands of the father of the flame perish, and may he perish
No profit will he have for all his wealth, and all his gains
He will soon burn in a fire of a blazing flame
His wife will carry the wood as fuel
With a twisted rope of palm-leaf fiber around her neck
Say, He is God, the One and Only
God, the Eternal, Absolute
He has no children, nor was He born
And nothing is like Him
Say, I seek refuge with the Guardian Evolver of the dawn
From the harm of created things
From the harm of darkness as it overspreads
From the harm of those who whisper into convictions
And from the harm of the envious one as he practices envy
Say, I seek refuge with the Guardian Evolver of humanity
The King of humanity
The God of humanity
From the harm of the whisperer, who withdraws after he whispers
And who whispers into the hearts of humanity
Among jinn and humanity
